text: 8 CFR Ch. I (1–1–08 Edition)
label: BODY

text: based upon the evaluation of the recog-
label: BODY

text: nized professional. The Service re-
label: BODY

text: serves the right to request additional
label: BODY

text: evaluations from expert witnesses cho-
label: BODY

text: sen by the Service. Requests for addi-
label: BODY

text: tional evaluations must be authorized
label: BODY

text: by the Assistant Regional Commis-
label: BODY

text: sioner for Adjudications.
label: BODY

text: (vii) Licensed clinical social workers,
label: BODY

text: psychologists, and psychiatrists are
label: BODY

text: professionals recognized by the Service
label: BODY

text: for the purpose of this section. A clin-
label: BODY

text: ical social worker who is not licensed
label: BODY

text: only because the state in which he or
label: BODY

text: she practices does not provide for li-
label: BODY

text: censing will be considered a licensed
label: BODY

text: professional recognized by the Service
label: BODY

text: if he or she is included in the Register
label: BODY

text: of Clinical Social Workers published by
label: BODY

text: the National Association of Social
label: BODY

text: Workers or is certified by the Amer-
label: BODY

text: ican Board of Examiners in Clinical So-
label: BODY

text: cial Work.
label: BODY

text: (viii) As directed by the statute, the
label: BODY

text: information contained in the applica-
label: BODY

text: tion and supporting documents shall
label: BODY

text: not be released without a court order
label: BODY

text: or the written consent of the applicant;
label: BODY

text: or, in the case of a child, the written
label: BODY

text: consent of the parent or legal guardian
label: BODY

text: who filed the waiver application on the
label: BODY

text: child’s behalf. Information may be re-
label: BODY

text: leased only to the applicant, his or her
label: BODY

text: authorized representative, an officer of
label: BODY

text: the Department of Justice, or any fed-
label: BODY

text: eral or State law enforcement agency.
label: BODY

text: Any information provided under this
label: BODY

text: part may be used for the purposes of
label: BODY

text: enforcement of the Act or in any crimi-
label: BODY

text: nal proceeding.
label: BODY

text: (f) Decision. The director shall pro-
label: BODY

text: vide the alien with written notice of
label: BODY

text: the decision on the application for
label: BODY

text: waiver. If the decision is adverse, the
label: BODY

text: director shall advise the alien of the
label: BODY

text: reasons therefor, notify the alien of the
label: BODY

text: termination of his or her permanent
label: BODY

text: residence status, instruct the alien to
label: BODY

text: surrender
label: BODY

text: any
label: BODY

text: Permanent
label: BODY

text: Resident
label: BODY

text: Card issued by the Service and issue a
label: BODY

text: notice to appear placing the alien in re-
label: BODY

text: moval proceedings. No appeal shall lie
label: BODY

text: from the decision of the director; how-
label: BODY

text: ever, the alien may seek review of such
label: BODY

text: decision in removal proceedings.

text: [53 FR 30018, Aug. 10, 1988, as amended at 56
label: BODY

text: Petition by entrepreneur to re-
label: BODY

text: move conditional basis of lawful
label: BODY

text: permanent resident status.
label: BODY

text: (a) Filing the petition—(1) General pro-
label: BODY

text: cedures. A petition to remove the con-
label: BODY

text: ditional basis of the permanent resi-
label: BODY

text: dent status of an alien accorded condi-
label: BODY

text: tional permanent residence pursuant to
label: BODY

text: section 203(b)(5) of the Act must be
label: BODY

text: filed by the alien entrepreneur on
label: BODY

text: Form I–829, Petition by Entrepreneur
label: BODY

text: to Remove Conditions. The alien entre-
label: BODY

text: preneur must file Form I–829 within
label: BODY

text: the 90-day period preceding the second
label: BODY

text: anniversary of his or her admission to
label: BODY

text: the United States as a conditional per-
label: BODY

text: manent resident. Before Form I–829
label: BODY

text: may be considered as properly filed, it
label: BODY

text: must be accompanied by the fee re-
label: BODY

text: quired under § 103.7(b)(1) of this chap-
label: BODY

text: ter, and by documentation as described
label: BODY

text: in paragraph (a)(4) of this section, and
label: BODY

text: it must be properly signed by the alien.
label: BODY

text: Upon receipt of a properly filed Form
label: BODY

text: I–829, the alien’s conditional perma-
label: BODY

text: nent resident status shall be extended
label: BODY

text: automatically, if necessary, until such
label: BODY

text: time as the director has adjudicated
label: BODY

text: the petition. The entrepreneur’s spouse
label: BODY

text: and children should be included in the
label: BODY

text: petition to remove conditions. Children
label: BODY

text: who have reached the age of twenty-
label: BODY

text: one or who have married during the pe-
label: BODY

text: riod of conditional permanent resi-
label: BODY

text: dence and the former spouse of an en-
label: BODY

text: trepreneur, who was divorced from the
label: BODY

text: entrepreneur during the period of con-
label: BODY

text: ditional permanent residence, may be
label: BODY

text: included in the alien entrepreneur’s pe-
label: BODY

text: tition or may file a separate petition.
label: BODY

text: (2) Jurisdiction. Form I–829 must be
label: BODY

text: filed with the regional service center
label: BODY

text: having jurisdiction over the location of
label: BODY

text: the alien entrepreneur’s commercial
label: BODY

text: enterprise in the United States.
label: BODY

text: (3) Physical presence at time of filing. A
label: BODY

text: petition may be filed regardless of
label: BODY

text: whether the alien is physically present
label: BODY

text: in the United States. However, if the
label: BODY

text: alien is outside the United States at
label: BODY

text: the time of filing, he or she must re-
label: BODY

text: turn to the United States, with his or
label: BODY

text: her spouse and children, if necessary,
label: BODY

text: to comply with the interview require-
label: BODY

text: ments contained in the Act. Once the
label: BODY

text: petition has been properly filed, the
label: BODY

text: alien may travel outside the United
label: BODY

text: States and return if in possession of
label: BODY

text: documentation
label: BODY

text: set
label: BODY

text: forth
label: BODY

text: Department of Homeland Security
label: BODY

text: § 211.1(b)(1) of this chapter, provided the
label: BODY

text: alien complies with the interview re-
label: BODY

text: quirements described in paragraph (b)
label: BODY

text: of this section. An alien who is not
label: BODY

text: physically present in the United States
label: BODY

text: during the filing period but subse-
label: BODY

text: quently applies for admission to the
label: BODY

text: United States shall be processed in ac-
label: BODY

text: cordance with § 235.11 of this chapter.
label: BODY

text: (4) Documentation. The petition for
label: BODY

text: removal of conditions must be accom-
label: BODY

text: panied by the following evidence:
label: BODY

text: (i) Evidence that a commercial enter-
label: BODY

text: prise was established by the alien.
label: BODY

text: Such evidence may include, but is not
label: BODY

text: limited to, Federal income tax returns;
label: BODY

text: (ii) Evidence that the alien invested
label: BODY

text: or was actively in the process of invest-
label: BODY

text: ing the requisite capital. Such evidence
label: BODY

text: may include, but is not limited to, an
label: BODY

text: audited financial statement or other
label: BODY

text: probative evidence; and
label: BODY

text: (iii) Evidence that the alien sus-
label: BODY

text: tained the actions described in para-
label: BODY

text: graph (a)(4)(i) and (a)(4)(ii) of this sec-
label: BODY

text: tion throughout the period of the
label: BODY

text: alien’s residence in the United States.
label: BODY

text: The alien will be considered to have
label: BODY

text: sustained the actions required for re-
label: BODY

text: moval of conditions if he or she has, in
label: BODY

text: good faith, substantially met the cap-
label: BODY

text: ital investment requirement of the
label: BODY

text: statute and continuously maintained
label: BODY

text: his or her capital investment over the
label: BODY

text: two years of conditional residence.
label: BODY

text: Such evidence may include, but is not
label: BODY

text: limited to, bank statements, invoices,
label: BODY

text: receipts, contracts, business licenses,
label: BODY

text: Federal or State income tax returns,
label: BODY

text: and Federal or State quarterly tax
label: BODY

text: statements.
label: BODY

text: (iv) Evidence that the alien created
label: BODY

text: or can be expected to create within a
label: BODY

text: reasonable time ten full-time jobs for
label: BODY

text: qualifying employees. In the case of a
label: BODY

text: ‘‘troubled business’’ as defined in 8
label: BODY

text: CFR 204.6(j)(4)(ii), the alien entre-
label: BODY

text: preneur must submit evidence that the
label: BODY

text: commercial enterprise maintained the
label: BODY

text: number of existing employees at no
label: BODY

text: less than the pre-investment level for
label: BODY

text: the period following his or her admis-
label: BODY

text: sion as a conditional permanent resi-
label: BODY

text: dent. Such evidence may include pay-
label: BODY

text: roll records, relevant tax documents,
label: BODY

text: and Forms I–9.
label: BODY

text: (5) Termination of status for failure to
label: BODY

text: file petition. Failure to properly file
label: BODY

text: Form I–829 within the 90-day period im-
label: BODY

text: mediately preceding the second anni-
label: BODY

text: versary of the date on which the alien
label: BODY

text: obtained lawful permanent residence
label: BODY

text: on a conditional basis shall result in
label: BODY

text: the
label: BODY

text: automatic
label: BODY

text: termination
label: BODY

text: the
label: BODY

text: alien’s permanent resident status and
label: BODY

text: the
label: BODY

text: initiation
label: BODY

text: deportation
label: BODY

text: pro-
label: BODY

text: ceedings. The director shall send a
label: BODY

text: written notice of termination and an
label: BODY

text: order to show cause to an alien entre-
label: BODY

text: preneur who fails to timely file a peti-
label: BODY

text: tion for removal of conditions. No ap-
label: BODY

text: peal shall lie from this decision; how-
label: BODY

text: ever, the alien may request a review of
label: BODY

text: the determination during deportation
label: BODY

text: proceedings.
label: BODY

text: deportation
label: BODY

text: pro-
label: BODY

text: ceedings, the burden of proof shall rest
label: BODY

text: with the alien to show by a preponder-
label: BODY

text: ance of the evidence that he or she
label: BODY

text: complied with the requirement to file
label: BODY

text: the petition within the designated pe-
label: BODY

text: riod. The director may deem the peti-
label: BODY

text: tion to have been filed prior to the sec-
label: BODY

text: ond anniversary of the alien’s obtain-
label: BODY

text: ing conditional permanent resident
label: BODY

text: status and accept and consider a late
label: BODY

text: petition if the alien demonstrates to
label: BODY

text: the director’s satisfaction that failure
label: BODY

text: to file a timely petition was for good
label: BODY

text: cause and due to extenuating cir-
label: BODY

text: cumstances. If the late petition is filed
label: BODY

text: prior to jurisdiction vesting with the
label: BODY

text: immigration judge in deportation pro-
label: BODY

text: ceedings and the director excuses the
label: BODY

text: late filing and approves the petition, he
label: BODY

text: or she shall restore the alien’s perma-
label: BODY

text: nent resident status, remove the condi-
label: BODY

text: tional basis of such status, and cancel
label: BODY

text: any outstanding order to show cause in
label: BODY

text: accordance with § 242.7 of this chapter.
label: BODY

text: If the petition is not filed until after
label: BODY

text: jurisdiction vests with the immigra-
label: BODY

text: tion judge, the immigration judge may
label: BODY

text: terminate the matter upon joint mo-
label: BODY

text: tion by the alien and the Service.
label: BODY

text: (6) Death of entrepreneur and effect on
label: BODY

text: spouse and children. If an entrepreneur
label: BODY

text: dies during the prescribed two-year pe-
label: BODY

text: riod of conditional permanent resi-
label: BODY

text: dence, the spouse and children of the
label: BODY

text: entrepreneur will be eligible for re-
label: BODY

text: moval of conditions if it can be dem-
label: BODY

text: onstrated that the conditions set forth
label: BODY

text: in paragraph (a)(4) of this section have
label: BODY

text: been met.
label: BODY

text: (b) Petition review—(1) Authority to
label: BODY

text: waive interview. The director of the
label: BODY

text: service center shall review the Form I–
label: BODY

text: 829 and the supporting documents to

label: BODY

text: determine whether to waive the inter-
label: BODY

text: view required by the Act. If satisfied
label: BODY

text: that the requirements set forth in
label: BODY

text: paragraph (c)(1) of this section have
label: BODY

text: been met, the service center director
label: BODY

text: may waive the interview and approve
label: BODY

text: the petition. If not so satisfied, then
label: BODY

text: the service center director shall for-
label: BODY

text: ward the petition to the district direc-
label: BODY

text: tor having jurisdiction over the loca-
label: BODY

text: tion of the alien entrepreneur’s com-
label: BODY

text: mercial enterprise in the United States
label: BODY

text: so that an interview of the alien entre-
label: BODY

text: preneur may be conducted. The direc-
label: BODY

text: tor must either waive the requirement
label: BODY

text: for an interview and adjudicate the pe-
label: BODY

text: tition or arrange for an interview with-
label: BODY

text: in 90 days of the date on which the pe-
label: BODY

text: tition was properly filed.
label: BODY

text: Location
label: BODY

text: interview.
label: BODY

text: Unless
label: BODY

text: waived, an interview relating to the
label: BODY

text: Form I–829 shall be conducted by an
label: BODY

text: immigration examiner or other officer
label: BODY

text: so designated by the district director
label: BODY

text: at the district office that has jurisdic-
label: BODY

text: tion over the location of the alien en-
label: BODY

text: trepreneur’s commercial enterprise in
label: BODY

text: the United States.
label: BODY

text: (3) Termination of status for failure to
label: BODY

text: appear for interview. If the alien fails to
label: BODY

text: appear for an interview in connection
label: BODY

text: with the petition when requested by
label: BODY

text: the Service, the alien’s permanent resi-
label: BODY

text: dent status will be automatically ter-
label: BODY

text: minated as of the second anniversary
label: BODY

text: of the date on which the alien obtained
label: BODY

text: permanent residence. The alien will be
label: BODY

text: provided with written notification of
label: BODY

text: the termination and the reasons there-
label: BODY

text: fore, and an order to show cause shall
label: BODY

text: be issued placing the alien under depor-
label: BODY

text: tation proceedings. The alien may seek
label: BODY

text: review of the decision to terminate his
label: BODY

text: or her status in such proceedings, but
label: BODY

text: the burden shall be on the alien to es-
label: BODY

text: tablish by a preponderance of the evi-
label: BODY

text: dence that he or she complied with the
label: BODY

text: interview requirements. If the alien
label: BODY

text: has failed to appear for a scheduled
label: BODY

text: interview, he or she may submit a writ-
label: BODY

text: ten request to the district director ask-
label: BODY

text: ing that the interview be rescheduled
label: BODY

text: or that the interview be waived. That
label: BODY

text: request should explain his or her fail-
label: BODY

text: ure to appear for the scheduled inter-
label: BODY

text: view, and if a request for waiver of the
label: BODY

text: interview, the reasons such waiver
label: BODY

text: should be granted. If the district direc-
label: BODY

text: tor determines that there is good cause
label: BODY

text: for granting the request, the interview
label: BODY

text: may be rescheduled or waived, as ap-
label: BODY

text: propriate.
label: BODY

text: the
label: BODY

text: district
label: BODY

text: director
label: BODY

text: waives the interview, he or she shall
label: BODY

text: restore the alien’s conditional perma-
label: BODY

text: nent resident status, cancel any out-
label: BODY

text: standing order to show cause in accord-
label: BODY

text: ance with § 242.7 of this chapter, and
label: BODY

text: proceed to adjudicate the alien’s peti-
label: BODY

text: tion. If the district director resched-
label: BODY

text: ules that alien’s interview, he or she
label: BODY

text: shall restore the alien’s conditional
label: BODY

text: permanent resident status, and cancel
label: BODY

text: any outstanding order to show cause in
label: BODY

text: accordance with § 242.7 of this chapter.
label: BODY

text: If the interview is rescheduled at the
label: BODY

text: request of the alien, the Service shall
label: BODY

text: not be required to conduct the inter-
label: BODY

text: view within the 90-day period following
label: BODY

text: the filing of the petition.
label: BODY

text: (c) Adjudication of petition. (1) The de-
label: BODY

text: cision on the petition shall be made
label: BODY

text: within 90 days of the date of filing or
label: BODY

text: within 90 days of the interview, which-
label: BODY

text: ever is later. In adjudicating the peti-
label: BODY

text: tion,
label: BODY

text: the
label: BODY

text: director
label: BODY

text: shall
label: BODY

text: determine
label: BODY

text: whether:
label: BODY

text: (i) A commercial enterprise was es-
label: BODY

text: tablished by the alien;
label: BODY

text: (ii) The alien invested or was ac-
label: BODY

text: tively in the process of investing the
label: BODY

text: requisite capital; and
label: BODY

text: (iii) The alien sustained the actions
label: BODY

text: described in paragraphs (c)(1)(i) and
label: BODY

text: (c)(1)(ii) of this section throughout the
label: BODY

text: period of the alien’s residence in the
label: BODY

text: United States. The alien will be consid-
label: BODY

text: ered to have sustained the actions re-
label: BODY

text: quired for removal of conditions if he
label: BODY

text: or she has, in good faith, substantially
label: BODY

text: met the capital investment require-
label: BODY

text: ment of the statute and continuously
label: BODY

text: maintained his or her capital invest-
label: BODY

text: ment over the two years of conditional
label: BODY

text: residence.
label: BODY

text: (iv) The alien created or can be ex-
label: BODY

text: pected to create within a reasonable
label: BODY

text: period of time ten full-time jobs to
label: BODY

text: qualifying employees. In the case of a
label: BODY

text: ‘‘troubled business’’ as defined in 8
label: BODY

text: CFR 204.6(j)(4)(ii), the alien maintained
label: BODY

text: the number of existing employees at no
label: BODY

text: less than the pre-investment level for
label: BODY

text: the previous two years.
label: BODY

text: (2) If derogatory information is deter-
label: BODY

text: mined regarding any of these issues or
label: BODY

text: it becomes known to the government
label: BODY

text: that the entrepreneur obtained his or
label: BODY

text: her investment funds through other
label: BODY

text: Department of Homeland Security
label: BODY

text: than legal means (such as through the
label: BODY

text: sale of illegal drugs), the director shall
label: BODY

text: offer the alien entrepreneur the oppor-
label: BODY

text: tunity to rebut such information. If
label: BODY

text: the alien entrepreneur fails to over-
label: BODY

text: come such derogatory information or
label: BODY

text: evidence the investment funds were ob-
label: BODY

text: tained through other than legal means,
label: BODY

text: the director may deny the petition,
label: BODY

text: terminate the alien’s permanent resi-
label: BODY

text: dent status, and issue an order to show
label: BODY

text: cause. If derogatory information not
label: BODY

text: relating to any of these issues is deter-
label: BODY

text: mined during the course of the inter-
label: BODY

text: view, such information shall be for-
label: BODY

text: warded to the investigations unit for
label: BODY

text: appropriate action. If no unresolved de-
label: BODY

text: rogatory information is determined re-
label: BODY

text: lating to these issues, the petition
label: BODY

text: shall be approved and the conditional
label: BODY

text: basis of the alien’s permanent resident
label: BODY

text: status removed, regardless of any ac-
label: BODY

text: tion taken or contemplated regarding
label: BODY

text: other possible grounds for deportation.
label: BODY

text: (d) Decision—(1) Approval. If, after ini-
label: BODY

text: tial review or after the interview, the
label: BODY

text: director approves the petition, he or
label: BODY

text: she will remove the conditional basis
label: BODY

text: of the alien’s permanent resident sta-
label: BODY

text: tus as of the second anniversary of the
label: BODY

text: alien’s entry as a conditional perma-
label: BODY

text: nent resident. He or she shall provide
label: BODY

text: written notice of the decision to the
label: BODY

text: alien and shall require the alien to re-
label: BODY

text: port to the appropriate district office
label: BODY

text: for processing for a new Permanent
label: BODY

text: Resident Card, Form I–551, at which
label: BODY

text: time the alien shall surrender any Per-
label: BODY

text: manent
label: BODY

text: Resident
label: BODY

text: Card
label: BODY

text: previously
label: BODY

text: issued.
label: BODY

text: (2) Denial. If, after initial review or
label: BODY

text: after the interview, the director denies
label: BODY

text: the petition, he or she shall provide
label: BODY

text: written notice to the alien of the deci-
label: BODY

text: sion and the reason(s) therefor, and
label: BODY

text: shall issue an order to show cause why
label: BODY

text: the alien should not be deported from
label: BODY

text: the United States. The alien’s lawful
label: BODY

text: permanent resident status and that of
label: BODY

text: his or her spouse and any children shall
label: BODY

text: be terminated as of the date of the di-
label: BODY

text: rector’s written decision. The alien
label: BODY

text: shall also be instructed to surrender
label: BODY

text: any Permanent Resident Card pre-
label: BODY

text: viously issued by the Service. No ap-
label: BODY

text: peal shall lie from this decision; how-
label: BODY

text: ever, the alien may seek review of the
label: BODY

text: decision in deportation proceedings. In
label: BODY

text: deportation proceedings, the burden
label: BODY

text: shall rest with the Service to establish
label: BODY

text: by a preponderance of the evidence
label: BODY

text: that the facts and information in the
label: BODY

text: alien’s petition for removal of condi-
label: BODY

text: tions are not true and that the petition
label: BODY

text: was properly denied.
